intro: Lysiclesia minor, commonly known as the small lysiclesia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Lysiclesia minor is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks.
